I also pulled down a vanilla workspace as per Gero's command line, but I get an error in u.a.d.scisoft.analysis.osgi, in plugin.xml. It can't find u.a.d.scisoft.analysis.rcp.preference.root which I *think* is an identifier which doesn't appear to be present in the Vanilla workspace (though it is in a Diamond workspace). I *think* this is screwing up the startup of the the FunctionFactoryExtensionService... The console shows these errors: [...] Alun Ashton 2015-03-04T11:35:14+00:00 2015-03-04T11:35:14+00:00 One day workshop on Automating and Simplifying Reduction of 2D powder diffraction data with DAWN https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;537a8505.1503 Dear All,<br><br>As part of the European Crystallography Meeting (http://ecm29.ecanews.org/<http://ecm29.ecanews.org/programme/satellite-meetings/>) there will be a one day satellite meeting on Automating and Simplifying Reduction of 2D powder diffraction data with DAWN.<br><br>Automating and Simplifying Reduction of 2D powder diffraction data with DAWN<br><br>Organizers: Diamond Light Source & Croatian Association of Crystallographers<br><br>When? August 23rd, 2015 (Sunday), 10:00 AM - 4:30 PM [...] BERNARD, Alain 2015-03-02T09:44:15+01:00 2015-03-02T09:44:15+01:00 Re: [science-iwg] Getting started DAWNSci https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;47e851ad.1503 Hi Matthew,<br><br>Thank you for your answer and your tips.<br>Yes I know the Kichwa Coders\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd team, as we are also interested in the AnalysisRPC project.<br>We already use the compatibility layer as our application is made of IDE plugins, but it seems to be conflicting versions issues between bundles required by DAWN and bundles required by Eclipse platform 4.4. Nevertheless, in a first time, I will try to make a showcase with our own data format in the whole DAWN product as you suggested.<br>I will contact the dev team if I encounter blocking points for this demo. [...] <> 2015-02-27T16:29:03+00:00 2015-02-27T16:29:03+00:00 Java 8 for GDA and Dawn - DEFERRED https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;532fc102.1502 Please note the following change of plan: for the upcoming (March 2015) release of Dawn (1.8) and GDA (8.44), we will continue to use a Java 7 JVM.<br>That also means that the JRE bundled with the Dawn build will be Java 7.<br><br>Previously, the intention had been to use a Java 8 JVM, but restricting our code to Java 7 compatibility (so that we could fall back to a Java 7 JVM if required).<br>However, GDA and Java 8 do not play well together (ticket GDA-6112<http://jira.diamond.ac.uk/i#browse/GDA-6112>). A solution is under discussion (ticket GDA-6113<http://jira.diamond.ac.uk/i#browse/GDA-6113>), but in the meantime we will [...] <> 2015-02-24T11:25:48+00:00 2015-02-24T11:25:48+00:00 Matt's crazy and controversial rules for SWT handles https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;f60422af.1502 With recent staff changes, I am concerned that SWT handles are being abused again because not everyone is aware of the issue. It causes your SWT app (GDA Client / DAWN for instance) to crash with a no more handles error:<br><br>Matt's crazy and controversial rules to keep handles from running out with SWT: [...] <> 2015-02-24T11:29:19+00:00 2015-02-24T11:29:19+00:00 Re: Matt's crazy and controversial rules for SWT handles https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;fba15917.1502 There's a plugin called sleak that can help check that you are doing things correctly: https://www.eclipse.org/swt/tools.php<br><br>Peter<br><br>From: Gerring, Matt (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)<br>Sent: 24 February 2015 11:26<br>To: Diamond GDA Developers; This provides a reference to the ILazyDataset in which a given slice belongs. This will mean than from a plotting tool, one can get a reference back to the ILazyDataset from which the slice came - for instance. [...] <> 2015-02-18T10:18:20+00:00 2015-02-18T10:18:20+00:00 Location and name of dawn-eclipse.git repository changed: affects DAWN and GDA master https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;50af4be8.1502 This email is about a Git repository that is used in DAWN and GDA. If is relevant to DAWN and GDA developers (not users).<br>This repository contains projects named like org.eclipse.dawnsci.*<br><br>As previously advised, the Git repository formerly located at git@github.com:DawnScience/dawn-eclipse.git<br>has been copied to the location git@github.com:eclipse/dawnsci.git (and changed name)<br>The old location will remain, but no updates will be accepted for it. [...] <> 2015-02-13T10:51:22+00:00 2015-02-13T10:51:22+00:00 Re: function integration? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;d216676d.1502 Hi Gero,<br><br>No, there are not any integration routines of 1D data or function at present in Dawn. There are two cases to cover: integrate a given dataset, and integrate a function (to a given accuracy). Perhaps you want to contribute a trapezoidal rule quadrature routine that works in a similar vein to NumPy's trapz for the former case. We could bind to the Apache Commons Math integrators for the latter case. I think it is that you fork, push to the fork and then create a request on the web page, Michael will accept the code, he is making changes in that area too at the moment but it is not hard for us to merge stuff in.
